contents.text: Leon is Soooo Hungry

contents.subtext: To read the rest of the story, complete a one-day challenge with your family.
contents.text: Do you want to know what's going to happen next?

It is exactly noon when Leon the Lion was hungry for lunch. 

"I haven't eaten anything since I woke up this morning," he says to himself. 

"I can't play this video game very well when I’m hungry," he thought.

Leon remembers that before his mother left for work, she left a plate of pasta in the fridge. 

Leon paused his video game, walked to the kitchen, and opened the fridge.

He pulled the pasta from the fridge’s shelf. However, because Leon was in such a rush to eat...
The whole dish of lasagna fell on to the floor, smothering the otherwise clean kitchen.

Now Leon is hungry and has nothing to eat.

However, he remembers that there is a takeout place two blocks from his home.

Leon immediately rushes to the foyer and opens the main door, but he was terrified. There were so many people outside and the traffic is very noisy.

Leon freezes for a minute or two because he is so terrified outside.
Then he hears a voice very familiar to him. “Hey, Leon what are you doing standing outside your door like that,” asks a grey-haired otter. It’s Mr. Oscar.
“I need to go to the take out place place over there, but I’m scared to walk there,” says Lonnie pointing to the directions to the take out place.

“Well I happen to be on my walk to the pharmacy that is next to the take out place,” says Mr. Oscar.

“We can walk there together and get some exercise. I can tell you my story of when many years ago I went on an expedition to the North Pole!” says Mr. Oscar.
“Yes, I would like to walk there and listen to your story,” said Leon.
The little lion jumped off the porch and walked together with Mr. Oscar.

contents.subtext: Any activity that makes you sweat or become out of breath. For example, running, playing in the park, dancing, swimming.
contents.text: Can you tell me a story when someone helped you on an activity?
How did it make you feel to have support in doing the activity?
Activity can also be fun! Find an activity you like to do

Chapter 2:
Leon Missed the Take Out Place

contents.subtext: To read the rest of the story, complete a one-day challenge with your family.
contents.text: Do you want to know what's going to happen next?

Leon and Mr. Oscar walked to the takeaway place to get Leon’s lunch.

While they walk briskly, Mr. Oscar tells Leon about his expedition to the North Pole.

Mr. Oscar tells Leon about the giant whale in the Arctic sea that can jump as high as a two-story house.

“They are big, but they surely can swim very fast,” says Mr. Leon as he concludes his story.

“Okay Leon, where are we going again?” asks Mr. Oscar.

Then Leon realizes that he has a problem. He didn’t realize that he misses the take out place while he was listening to Mr. Oscar’s super interesting story about the north pole expedition.

Leon is feeling upset again.

“I think we might have missed the takeaway restaurant,” says Leon.
“Oh, I’m sorry Leon. I guess I was just very excited to tell my stories,” says Mr. Oscar.
“You know what, see that place on the corner? They have amazing tacos and I’ll get some for you!” says Mr. Oscar.

So the little lion and the white-haired otter go to the taco place. 

Leon is a little exhausted and a little out of breath from the long walk.

But it was a fun walk anyway.

contents.subtext: Any activity that makes you sweat or become out of breath. For example, running, playing in the park, dancing, swimming.
contents.text: Can you think of an activity you have to do, that is also fun?
How does does the fun activity make you feel?
When you realize that exercise is fun, you will enjoy doing it.

Chapter 3:

Leon Meets Hubert

contents.subtext: To read the rest of the story, complete a one-day challenge with your family.
contents.text: Do you think Leon will get his food?

Mr. Oscar the white-haired otter helped Leon the lion to get tacos for lunch. However, as the two entered the takeaway place they find a long line of animals about to order tacos.

“I told you this tacos place is popular,” said Mr. Oscar as they walked into the end of the long line. However, suddenly Mr. Otter frowns.

However, suddenly Mr. Otter frowns.

“Oh my, it’s almost 3 ‘clock! I need to get my medicine from the pharmacy now,” yells Mr. Oscar.

“Leon, I will need to leave you here for ten minutes. I need to get my medicine now,” says Mr. Oscar while he gave two $10 bills to Leon. 

“Wait here. Order some tacos. I’ll be right back in ten minutes! Get me veggies tacos. Don’t go anywhere!” says the otter.

Leon is still trying to grasp what is going on while Mr. Oscar ran very quickly to the pharmacy.

And there is a problem: Leon is always nervous when ordering food in new restaurants.

As Leon waits in the line, he comes closer and closer to the grumpy restaurant staff who takes the order.

Leon has no idea what to do because he is very nervous.

Then he realizes that the person in front of him is somebody that he knows very well.

It’s Hubert Heron, also known as @whobert2005. He is a YouTube star, a video game expert, and the brother of Leon’s classmates.

“Hey Hubert, this is Leon!” says Leon.

Hubert looks very happy to see Leon. “Hey, buddy! How are you doing! What are you doing here?” says the Heron.

“I want to order tacos for me and Mr. Otter, but I always feel nervous when I’m in a new restaurant and the staff looks grumpy,” says Leon.

“Hah! That’s ok. People get nervous for many reasons! I can order the tacos for you, but it will be more fun if you order it yourself,” says Hubert. 

“Just say, ‘Can I get this taco and that taco please.’” says Hubert.

Leon feels more comfortable now that there is Hubert with him. Leon is a still a little nervous when it was his turn to order the food, but he decides to say:

“Hi, ma-am. Can I get two chicken tacos and two veggie tacos, please? Thanks,” says Leon. He is relieved.

Leon gave the money to the cashier and he got his tacos.

Immediately afterward he saw Mr. Oscar rush into the tacos place.

“Did you get the tacos?” asks Mr. Oscar.

“I did, and these are your tacos,” Leon answers.

“Hey Leon, do you want to hang out with my video game friends at that park across the street,” asks Hubert.

“Sure! Mr. Oscar do you want to join us?” asks Leon.
“I would love to! But I need to feed my goldfish John. Maybe next time?” says Mr. Oscars as he parts with Leon and Hubert.
Leon is excited now that he got really good tacos from Mr. Oscar and is going to hang out with Hubert’s video game friends.

contents.subtext: An "activity" is a thing you do that makes you sweat or become out of breath like running, playing in the park, dancing, or swimming.
contents.text: Can you tell me a time when you were unsure you could do a new activity?
How did it feel to ask an adult for help?
Sometimes, it can be scary to try new things! That is ok, just ask for help!.

Chapter 4:
Meeting the Video Games Expert

contents.subtext: To read the rest of the story, complete a one-day challenge with your family.
contents.text: Do you want to know the game that Leon will play with Hubert?

Leon and Hubert the video game expert are at the park across the tacos place. As they finish their tacos Leon hears several people say hi to Hubert. 

They are Hubert's friends who play video games a lot. They are video game experts!

“Hey guys,” says Hubert. “This little guy over here is Leon. He’s a good friend of my brother.”

“Hey Leon, how’s it going?” asks Bob.

“How are you doing, Leon?” says Clara.

“Hey Leon,” Bob shouts. “Do you want to play a game with us?” he asks.

Without any hesitation, Leon says, “Yes. Of course!” 

Leon loves playing video games, and playing with video game experts sounds like a lot of fun.
Then Bob says, “Great!” while he pull out a brown basketball out of his bag. “Come on let’s play a few games,” says Bob.
Leon is confused. “But, I thought we’re going to play video games,” he asks.

Hubert answers, “Oh no. We don’t play video games all the time. We also play basketball. 

It makes your heart stronger.” Then Hubert says, “Do you still want to play basketball with us?”
Leon says, “Yes!”
So the little lion played basketball with Hubert, Bob, and Clara.
They play until the sun almost sets.
Soon, Leon’s mom comes to pick him up. Leon is a little upset that he had to stop playing basketball.

But then, Hubert says something. “Hey, it was fun playing the game with you. Let’s plan to do this again this week!’

Leon is happy because he will play with Hubert, Bob, and Clara again this week. As he walked home with his Mom, Leon tells her how amazing his day was.

contents.subtext: Any activity that makes you sweat or become out of breath. For example, running, playing in the park, dancing, swimming.
contents.text: Leon was not sure if he can play basketball well. But it turns out he can play pretty well. Can you tell your own story when you’re trying a new activity?
How did it feel when you were finally doing the activity?
Sometimes planning our activities helps us achieve our goals!

The End

Your next story is:

"Fiona and the Case of Missing Carrots"
